page.title: 07Kirkconnel:Poetic Tradition
page.content: While Robert Burns has, as far as we can tell, no recorded association with Kirkconnel he would know it well through his journeys between Dumfries and his native Ayrshire. However, Kirkconnel boasts its own poetical heritage as being the birth-place of James Hyslop (23 July 1798) whose most notable work was 'The Cameronian Dream'. Alexander Anderson (30 April 1845) who wrote under the pseudonym 'Surfaceman' and who became Chief Librarian at Edinburgh University had several works published ,including 'A Song Of Labour and Other Poems'. This literary tradition is continued today by Robert Mathieson who has had 'Your Finest Hour and Other Poems' published.(Mr. Mathieson supplied the information on page2,'Kirkconnel:In My Young Days'.
